response:
The focal, brainstem-pattern signs strongly suggest a structural right midbrain lesion; the age and vascular risk profile determine stroke as the leading cause, but the pupil-involving third nerve palsy and concurrent optic neuropathy also raise concern for a compressive parasellar/PCOM aneurysm or mass, while multifocal demyelination (e.g. MS) and intrinsic midbrain tumour remain important alternatives.

differential_diagnosis = ["Right posterior circulation ischaemic stroke involving the midbrain (posterior cerebral artery branch infarct)", "Right posterior communicating artery aneurysm or parasellar/tentorial mass compressing the right optic nerve and midbrain", "Right midbrain haemorrhage (e.g. cavernous malformation or hypertensive bleed)", "Multiple sclerosis with right optic neuritis and right midbrain plaque", "Intrinsic right midbrain tumour (e.g. glioma or metastasis)"]
